items.title: VI Live: Saibari mist grote kans voor Marokko, Lammens redt Man Utd
items.summary: Traditiegetrouw wordt er in Engeland gevoetbald op Boxing Day. Ditmaal geen uitgebreid programma, maar slechts √©√©n duel: Manchester United tegen Newcastle United. Daarnaast speelt Marokko om 21.00 uur in de Afrika Cup tegen Mali. Volg de duels in deze VI Live.

items.title: Zes duels schorsing voor Sevilla-verdediger vanwege onder meer beledigen
items.summary: In Spanje is er een hele serieuze schorsing uitgedeeld naar aanleiding van de rode kaart die Marc√§o afgelopen weekend kreeg tegen Real Madrid. De centrale verdediger van Sevilla mag liefst zes wedstrijden brommen.

items.title: Manchester United v Newcastle: Premier League ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Premier League updates from the 8pm GMT kick-off ‚öΩ Live scores | Table | Mail Scott The teams are out! It‚Äôs a heartwarming festive scene, because whenever these storied old clubs meet, both get to keep on their famous kits. Manchester United in red and black, Newcastle United in black and white. A classic look as everyone trots out to the strains of This Is The One. A poignant chime to the track tonight, Manchester having said farewell to one of United‚Äôs biggest fans earlier this week. Go well, Mani. Our pre-match postbag is positively brimming with festive cheer. ‚ÄúA goal-glut for the ages, eh? Why do I feel like I‚Äôm in for the biggest Christmas let-down since I asked my da for the Barcelona Subbuteo team and opened up the box under the tree to find‚Ä¶ Burnley? Yours, Scrooge and the Grinch‚Äù ‚Äì Justin Kavanagh Continue reading...

items.title: Afcon roundup: Mohamed Salah strikes again as 10-man Egypt hold off South Africa
items.summary: Salah penalty gives Egypt second win in two Angola and Zimbabwe battle to 1-1 draw Mohamed Salah scored a first-half penalty as 10-man Egypt defeated South Africa 1-0 in their Africa Cup of Nations Group B clash in Agadir on Friday to become the first team into the knockout stages of the competition. Egypt have six points from their opening two games and cannot finish outside of the top two in the group. South Africa have three points from their two games, while Zimbabwe and Angola have one each after they drew 1-1 earlier in the day. Continue reading...

items.title: Mbapp√© als Hakimi- en Marokko-fan op de Afrika Cup
items.summary: Vrijdagavond speelt Marokko een belangrijk duel op de Afrika Cup tegen Mali. Die wedstrijd heeft een opvallende toeschouwer: niemand minder dan Kylian Mbapp√© is over komen vliegen om de wedstrijd te bekijken.

items.title: TOP Oss-sterkhouder verkast naar hekkensluiter in Schotland
items.summary: Joshua Zimmerman verlaat TOP Oss en maakt de overstap naar Livingston FC. De international van Cura√ßao speelde jarenlang voor de Keuken Kampioen Divisie-club, maar verkast in de komende transferperiode naar het Schotse Premiership.

items.title: Draper to miss Australian Open due to injury recovery
items.summary: Jack Draper has announced he will miss next month's Australian Open after admitting he is not quite ready for a return to top-level competition.

items.title: Slot needed to 'convince' Ekitike to reach best form
items.summary: Liverpool striker Hugo Ekitike's five goals in four matches suggest he is starting to get to grips with the Premier League but head coach Arne Slot admits he had to push the player to reach his current levels.

items.title: Arteta 'hacked off' by Rice's time-wasting red card
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has revealed he was "hacked off" by Arsenal's draw with Brighton & Hove Albionlast season but hailed his side's improved disciplinary record this term.

items.title: Forest's 'greatest' John Robertson dies at 72
items.summary: Former Nottingham Forest and Scotland winger John Robertson has died at the age of 72, the Premier League club have announced.

items.title: NEC neemt definitief afscheid van Larsen
items.summary: We zitten in het intermezzo tussen de zomer- en winterwindow, toch druppelt er in het najaar vaak nog een aantal transfers binnen. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: Forest to rename stand in honour of Robertson
items.summary: Nottingham Forest are to rename a stand at the City Ground to honour their "great hero" John Robertson, who died at the age of 72 this week.

items.title: Edinburgh derby, Askou & Hatate in spotlight
items.summary: Who will triumph in the second Edinburgh derby of the season? Will Motherwell manager Jens Berthel Askou make it 11 league matches unbeaten? And will Celtic midfielder Reo Hatate continue his excellent creative output?

items.title: Championship roundup: Coventry go eight points clear while Leicester lose again
items.summary: Ipswich and Millwall draw; Bristol City beat Albion Oxford shock Saints; Pompey denied by QPR Coventry stretched their lead at the top of the Championship to eight points with a hard-fought 1-0 win over Swansea while second-placed Middlesbrough could only draw with Blackburn. Ephron Mason-Clark‚Äôs emphatic finish just before half-time was enough to give Frank Lampard‚Äôs side a ninth home Championship win of the season. But the usually free-scoring Sky Blues were made to work hard for the points and were perhaps somewhat fortunate to have found themselves in front at half-time. The resolute visitors had done a fine job in keeping the hosts quiet but were undone a minute before the break by Mason-Clark‚Äôs opener. Continue reading...

items.title: Cautious Middlesbrough lose ground on leaders with goalless Blackburn draw
items.summary: Kim Hellberg‚Äôs determination to succeed as Middlesbrough manager runs deep. So deep that he decided it would be best if his wife and two small children spent Christmas in their native Sweden while he continued to put in long days on Teesside. Given that the Hellberg family will soon be reunited in a new home in North Yorkshire and Blackburn‚Äôs visit represented the first of four games in nine days it seemed a sensible sacrifice ‚Äì even if such pragmatism failed to pay the desired Boxing Day dividends. The former Hammarby head coach had hoped to celebrate the completion of his first month in charge at the Riverside Stadium after succeeding the Wolves-bound Rob Edwards with three points but Blackburn, and their irrepressible midfielder Todd Cantwell in particular, had different ideas. Continue reading...

items.title: Salah scores again as 10-man Egypt hold on against South Africa
items.summary: Mohamed Salah scored again as 10-man Egypt secured top spot in Group B of the Africa Cup of Nations with a 1-0 win against South Africa.

items.title: PL Predictions: Cunha or nothing for Man Utd? Nothing it is

items.title: Man City players 'incredibly disciplined' - Guardiola
items.summary: Pep Guardiola says his players will have remained "incredibly disciplined" during the Christmas break to meet the standards Manchester City have set.
